required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, Dose Ranging Study, Safety, Tolerability and Immunogenicity
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, Dose Ranging Study of the Safety, Tolerability and Immunogenicity of Two Doses of a Clostridium Difficile Toxoid Vaccine, Alum Adsorbed, in Healthy Adult Volunteers (18 - 55 Years)

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase I, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blinded, dose ranging study to assess the safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of 2 dose levels of C. difficile vaccine. Population: healthy male and female adults, 18 to 55 years old.

detailed_description.textblock: This was a Phase I, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blinded, dose ranging study designed to assess the safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of C. difficile vaccine. The study was conducted in healthy male and female adults, 18 to 55 years old. Subjects was randomly assigned on Day 0 to receive one of two doses of C. difficile vaccine (50 or 100 mcg) or placebo (vehicle control containing alum).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events Post-vaccination With One of Two Formulations of Clostridium Difficile Toxoid Vaccine or a Placebo Vaccine.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 up to 70 days post first vaccination

arm_group.description: Participants scheduled to receive a dose of placebo vaccine on Day 0, Day 28, and Day 56, respectively.
Participants scheduled to receive a dose of 50 μg Clostridium Difficile vaccine on Day 0, Day 28, and Day 56, respectively.
Participants scheduled to receive a dose of 100 μg Clostridium Difficile vaccine on Day 0, Day 28, and Day 56, respectively.

intervention.description: 0.5 mL, Intramuscular at Day 0, Day 28 and Day 56, respectively.
0.5 mL, Intramuscular at Day 0, Day 28 and Day 56, respectively.
0.5 mL, Intramuscular on Day 0, Day 28 and Day 56, respectively.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult males or females, 18 - 55 years in good general health
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of current C. difficile infection, as determined by a positive stool C. difficile cytotoxin assay at screening
- Evidence of any previous antibiotic-associated diarrhea caused by any etiology including C. difficile that required medical intervention or medication
- Active or inactive irritable bowel disease, chronic abdominal pain, chronic diarrhea of any etiology, or inflammatory bowel disease.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled on 28 March 2006 in 2 clinical centers in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 36 participants who met the inclusion, but no exclusion criteria were enrolled and vaccinated.

group.title: Placebo Vaccine Group
group.description: Participants received a dose of placebo (vaccine diluent) on Day 0 and Day 28.

group.title: Clostridium Difficile Toxoid Vaccine Group 1
group.description: Participants received a dose of 50 μg Clostridium difficile toxoid vaccine on Day 0 and Day 28.

group.description: Participants received a dose of 100 μg Clostridium difficile toxoid vaccine on Day 0 and Day 28.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events data were collected from the day of vaccination 1 (Day 0) to up to 8 months post-vaccination.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor must have the opportunity to review at least 60 days prior to submission for publication or presentation. If review indicates that potentially patentable subject matter would be disclosed, publication or public disclosure may be delayed for a maximum of an additional 60 days to allow for filing the necessary patent applications

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was terminated early in light of issues with CTM stability. All other study procedures and visits were performed per protocol.
